DOC.brief_summary: Time to intubate, view to glottic opening and success rate are not different when Airtraq technique is used compared to standard direct laryngoscopy in children.
DOC.brief_title: Airtraq Versus Standard Direct Laryngoscopy in the Pediatric Airway
DOC.detailed_description: 50 children (age 5 years and 11 month or younger) with expected easy intubation, scheduled for elective surgery requiring endotracheal intubation are enrolled.
DOC.criteria: elective surgery requiring endotracheal intubation predicted difficult bagmask ventilation predicted difficult intubation rapid sequence induction emergency endotracheal intubation hemodynamic instability emergency surgery nonenglish speaking caregivers/parents
